intro: Tapinanthus verrucosus, commonly known as the疣果寄生藤, is a parasitic plant belonging to the Orobanchaceae family. It lacks chlorophyll and relies entirely on its host for nutrients, typically attaching to the roots of other plants. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers and has a unique, hairy appearance on its stems and fruits. It is native to arid regions of Africa and is often found in association with shrubs and trees. Due to its parasitic nature, it can significantly impact the growth and survival of its host plants.
